items.title: Dilon mein tum..
items.content_text: Dilon mein tum apniBetaabiyan leke chal rahe hoToh zinda ho tumNazar mein khwabon kiBijliyan leke chal rahe hoToh zinda ho tumHawa ke jhokon ke jaiseAazad rehno sikhoTum ek dariya ke jaiseLehron mein behna sikhoHar ek lamhe se tum miloKhole apni bhaayeinHar ek pal ek naya samhaDekhen yeh nigahaeinJo apni aankhon meinHairaniyan leke chal rahe hoToh zinda ho tumDilon mein tum apniBetaabiyan leke chal rahe hoToh zinda ho tum- Zindagi Na Milegi Dobara

items.title: Top Gun: Maverick ‚Äì 2022
items.content_text: One of the best movies of 2022! Action-packed, outstanding cinematography. Missed a lot of references though, because I haven‚Äôt watched the first instalment (Yeah, big mistake. I should‚Äôve watched it). Cannot believe that two movies were shot 36 years apart. Tom Cruise sure is still at the top of his game. A solid 8/10!Watch the trailer here.
items.content_html:
One of the best movies of 2022! Action-packed, outstanding cinematography. Missed a lot of references though, because I haven‚Äôt watched the first instalment (Yeah, big mistake. I should‚Äôve watched it). Cannot believe that two movies were shot 36 years apart. Tom Cruise sure is still at the top of his game. A solid 8/10!

Watch the trailer here.

items.title: Chasing the Bullet ‚Äì a Royal Enfield documentary
items.content_text: Lucky to have started my motorcycling journey on a Royal Enfield, back in 2019! Here‚Äôs a great documentary on The Bullet by Chris Zahner.Watch the documentary here.

items.title: So many books, so little time
items.content_text: One glance at a book and you hear the voice of another person, perhaps someone dead for 1,000 years. To read is to voyage through time.               Carl Sagan

items.title: The Irishman ‚Äì 2019
items.content_text: A sublime 7/10! Watched this 3+ hour flick in chunks. The story is intriguing, the cast is unparalleled, and the movie has The Godfather-like vibes to it because of the similar setting and period in which the storyline runs. Worth spending three hours on? Yup!Watch the trailer here.
items.content_html:
A sublime 7/10! Watched this 3+ hour flick in chunks. The story is intriguing, the cast is unparalleled, and the movie has The Godfather-like vibes to it because of the similar setting and period in which the storyline runs. Worth spending three hours on? Yup!

Watch the trailer here.

items.title: About the site
items.content_text: After being hosted on GitHub Pages for >2 years, this site is now Powered by WordPress. I had not planned to make this shift so soon, as building with Jekyll was simple and nothing can beat the performance of a static site.This website is currently operating at a $40 loss YoY from domain name renewal. and WP hosting charges. (No plan to monetize the site either ‚Äì Ads/Subscription)An archive of all previous posts would be hosted on my GitHub.io soon (my weekend project).Update (7 Jun, 2022)Moved the blog from pratiknilange.in to pratik.nl. So there goes another $20/yr. I should seriously refrain from buying any more domains ü§¶üèº‚Äç‚ôÇÔ∏è.Update (30 Oct, 2022)And the site is back to pavilion ü¶ó. Coming to the details, it is primarily built in HTML and Markdown. Preprocessed by Jekyll. It‚Äôs hosted on Github, protected and distributed globally by Cloudflare ‚ö°.
items.content_html:
After being hosted on GitHub Pages for >2 years, this site is now Powered by WordPress. I had not planned to make this shift so soon, as building with Jekyll was simple and nothing can beat the performance of a static site.

This website is currently operating at a $40 loss YoY from domain name renewal. and WP hosting charges. (No plan to monetize the site either ‚Äì Ads/Subscription)

An archive of all previous posts would be hosted on my GitHub.io soon (my weekend project).

Update (7 Jun, 2022)

Moved the blog from pratiknilange.in to pratik.nl. So there goes another $20/yr. I should seriously refrain from buying any more domains ü§¶üèº‚Äç‚ôÇÔ∏è.

Update (30 Oct, 2022)

And the site is back to pavilion ü¶ó. Coming to the details, it is primarily built in HTML and Markdown. Preprocessed by Jekyll. It‚Äôs hosted on Github, protected and distributed globally by Cloudflare ‚ö°.

items.title: Huion HS64
items.content_text: Huion's HS64 graphic tabletI had ordered Huion‚Äôs HS64 from Amazon some days ago. It works pretty well. I liked the pen‚Äôs grip, the tablet feels sturdy, but there are some tiny scratches already. I will be creating some stuff with it till I run out of nibs (8 of them available in the box), only after which I would be mentally ready for an Apple pencil kind of commitment.
items.content_html: I had ordered Huion‚Äôs HS64 from Amazon some days ago. It works pretty well. I liked the pen‚Äôs grip, the tablet feels sturdy, but there are some tiny scratches already. I will be creating some stuff with it till I run out of nibs (8 of them available in the box), only after which I would be mentally ready for an Apple pencil kind of commitment.

items.title: 400 Days by Chetan Bhagat
items.content_text: Rating ‚Äì ‚≠ê‚≠ê‚≠êHow do I put it? The case that Saurabh and Keshav are working on this time, isn‚Äôt as thrilling as the previous ones. There‚Äôs the usual North Saas-South Bahu rift (more of a distraction), the plot gets too predictable mid-way. Now CB‚Äôs writing style is, fineish, some people like it, some don‚Äôt. 400 days definitely can‚Äôt be listed in his Top 5 works, or Top 10 for that matter (Oh, just checked his wiki, this is his 10th Fiction, so it is in the Top 10 by default. Let‚Äôs hope it doesn‚Äôt stay there for long).
items.content_html:
Rating ‚Äì ‚≠ê‚≠ê‚≠ê

How do I put it? The case that Saurabh and Keshav are working on this time, isn‚Äôt as thrilling as the previous ones. There‚Äôs the usual North Saas-South Bahu rift (more of a distraction), the plot gets too predictable mid-way. Now CB‚Äôs writing style is, fineish, some people like it, some don‚Äôt. 400 days definitely can‚Äôt be listed in his Top 5 works, or Top 10 for that matter (Oh, just checked his wiki, this is his 10th Fiction, so it is in the Top 10 by default. Let‚Äôs hope it doesn‚Äôt stay there for long).

items.title: When you come out of the storm..
items.content_text: And once the storm is over, you won‚Äôt remember how you made it through, how you managed to survive. You won‚Äôt even be sure, whether the storm is really over. But one thing is certain. When you come out of the storm, you won‚Äôt be the same person who walked in. That‚Äôs what this storm‚Äôs all about                Haruki Murakami Kafka on the Shore

items.title: Field trip
items.content_html: Somewhere in Karnataka.

items.title: What the hell was I thinking?!
items.content_text: I turned 19 this Summer (March to be precise) and I was up for a driving license test. I don‚Äôt know about it in other countries, but here in India it‚Äôs a serious business and you got to have pretty good driving skills to pass this test (unless you have a fixer). For non-transport vehicles, there are two variants of this test: A two-wheeler license test (For Motorcycle with Gear) and a Four-Wheeler License (For Cars). To ease up things a little, we consider driving a bike or a car whose dimensions and capacity are, you know, smaller compared to the ones we drive on road.The deadly serpentine track consists of some really steep (geometrical disaster) turns which can surely give you a twinge in the ass (while driving a bike of course).  Now out of curiosity or utter stupidity, my choice of bike was a Royal Enfield Classic.Talking about its dimensions, the bike is about 2.2 meters long (7.3ft), 0.8 meters wide (2.2ft). Fortunately, it has a power start.    Yes, I had to stick an ugly learner's sign on the front and back sides of the bike.Fast-forward to the result, I can say that I survived the test. It was an automobile-miracle that I could drive this beast and pass the test. For the people who are reading this post and are planning to pass the license test on this bike, I would like to tell them one thing, ‚ÄúDarr ke aage Jeet Hain‚Äù.
items.content_html:
I turned 19 this Summer (March to be precise) and I was up for a driving license test. I don‚Äôt know about it in other countries, but here in India it‚Äôs a serious business and you got to have pretty good driving skills to pass this test (unless you have a fixer). For non-transport vehicles, there are two variants of this test: A two-wheeler license test (For Motorcycle with Gear) and a Four-Wheeler License (For Cars). To ease up things a little, we consider driving a bike or a car whose dimensions and capacity are, you know, smaller compared to the ones we drive on road.

The deadly serpentine track consists of some really steep (geometrical disaster) turns which can surely give you a twinge in the ass (while driving a bike of course). Now out of curiosity or utter stupidity, my choice of bike was a Royal Enfield Classic.

Talking about its dimensions, the bike is about 2.2 meters long (7.3ft), 0.8 meters wide (2.2ft). Fortunately, it has a power start.

Fast-forward to the result, I can say that I survived the test. It was an automobile-miracle that I could drive this beast and pass the test. For the people who are reading this post and are planning to pass the license test on this bike, I would like to tell them one thing, ‚ÄúDarr ke aage Jeet Hain‚Äù.
